author: morningstar.com
title: Infosys Second-Quarter Net Profit Rises 9.8%
text:
Infosys Ltd. on Monday reported a 9.8% rise in its net profit in the fiscal second quarter, helped by an uptick in new deals.
India's second-largest software exporter by sales said its consolidated net profit in the three months ended Sept. 30 stood at 33.98 billion rupees ($525 million), compared with 30.96 billion rupees a year earlier.
That was marginally higher than the 32.91 billion rupees forecast in a consensus of analysts surveyed by Thomson Reuters. Revenue grew 17% to 156.35 billion rupees.
The company expects its revenue in the current financial year to grow 6.4%-8.4% in dollar terms, lower than its previous revenue-growth estimate of 7.2%-9.2%.
Infosys also said its current Chief Financial Officer Rajiv Bansal will resign at the end of Monday and named M.D. Ranganath as new CFO.
The company's share price fell 3.7% to 1124.95 rupees after the company lowered its revenue guidance.
Write to Debiprasad Nayak at debi.nayak@wsj.com and Newley Purnell at newley.purnell @wsj.com
 12, 2015 01:05 ET (05:05
